name: Easy Lemon-Pepper Blackened Salmon
author: CHELSEA713
summary: This delicious blackened salmon fillet is infused with lemon. It's a quick and easy recipe the whole family will love!
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Whisk together the butter, lemon juice, parsley, garlic powder, salt, and pepper
Dip the salmon into the sauce so the flesh side is coated, and set on a plate, Heat the olive oil in an ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat
When the oil begins to smoke, add the salmon, placing it skin side up into the skillet
Cook for until the flesh is seared and golden brown, about 1 minute
Place the skillet into the preheated oven, and cook until the salmon flakes easily with a fork, 10 to 12 minutes
